reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very good location in the heart of the city
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Staff is really friendly and helpful - speak perfectly french
reviews.title: Antiquated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - rooms are OK, not large but that's enough - nice bathrooms
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - perfect cleaning
reviews.title: Cheap...at a price. Stay at your own risk!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Breakfast OK
reviews.title: Excellent location and excellent service from staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to unexpectedly change our itinerary the night before we left on our vacation and found this hotel last minute in Pisa. Not perfect, but we would recommend, especially given the other options in this city.
reviews.title: Last Minute Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: The night front desk attendant (can't remember her name) spoke PERFECT English and was very friendly. She even tried to help us make bus reservations when I realized we needed reservations on our bus to Siena the following day. Hotel was clean and safe -- if you've never been to Pisa before, this is not always true in this city.
reviews.title: Good quality B&B in a handy location for the Leaning Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: Room was tiny, but we were only there for one night and didn't really mind. I think there are probably better deals to be had in Pisa, but be careful as Pisa is a little seedier than other Tuscan cities. Breakfast was not served in the hotel. Rather, we had to walk about 10 mins over to their sister hotel (the five star hotel in town) to have breakfast, which was still free. Nice to eat breakfast in a five star hotel, but some of the staff at this hotel were uppity and rude and I would have rather have just been able to eat in our hotel as we were leaving immediately after breakfast and had our luggage with us .
reviews.title: Relais Dei Fiori

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you choose not to stay at this fairly posh 12 bedroom B&B situated less than 10 minutes walk from the Leaning Tower, don’t do so only because it has limited reception hours from 2pm to 9pm. There are plenty of comments about the issue on Trip Advisor so potential guests are well warned. But remember, Relais dei Fiori is “only” a B&B and it does have a big sister hotel Relais Dell Orologico less than 5 minutes suitcase pull away, which can be called on 24 hours a day if necessary. Do like we did. We got off our early morning flight, headed straight to the Orologico by way of a 10 minute €10 taxi ride from the airport, dumped our bags with the lady in reception, (who also organised our Fiori check in), and we got on with our day. After collecting our bags mid afternoon when Fiori reception was open we got into our room and freshened up before heading out again. The 2 ladies who manned Fiori reception on different days were very friendly and helpful and have great English – very useful for us dummies who can’t speak more than a few words in other languages, frequently menu related.
reviews.title: Good Value if you accept limited opening hours at Reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fiori has 4 ensuite rooms on each of its 3 floors. These are described as standard, deluxe & executive. We booked an executive room through Expedia when it was advertising a “room sale” and were very happy with what we got. When we asked at check in if it would be possible to have a room at the back we were told that the executive rooms (we assume there are 3) all face the road to the front, Via Carducci. Fiori is in a terraced building that is just 4 windows wide. Our very Italian chintzy bedroom was about 14 foot square with 2 large windows and our bathroom was about 9 by 6 with its own window – so it seems the executive rooms are lucky enough to each have 3 of the available 4 windows facing the front! The double bed is actually 2 singles pushed together making it over 6 foot wide. The satellite flatscreen TV appears to have hundreds of channels from all over the globe but only BBC World News in English. The safe in the room is free, as are a couple of bottles of water in the fridge. The marble bathroom was nicely appointed with a small Jacuzzi bath and a shower over the bath with a glass shower screen (which could have been fitted better to stop water leakage). There also appeared to be a leak from the plug hole end of the bath which we reported by email after we got home. Housekeeping was otherwise immaculate and we even got clean towels AND sheets every day. The claimed 5 star status of the sister hotel obviously rubs off a bit.
reviews.title: A well located hotel, clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 days on a trip through italy and france so wanted good value for money hotels, this cost us £120 for 2 nights b&b.We turned up at 10am and the hotel staff let us into the room early which was great as it was pouring down. A room maybe on the small size but not that small that you feel cramped, The rooms are beautifully decorated, a massive walk in shower and kept very clean and tidy. The breakfast was continental which was enough to keep you going till lunchtime had fruit, cereals, fresh bread and cakes and one hot drink. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk to the tower and very close to the centre.
reviews.title: A little gem of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviews have said this is in an excellent location. Found staff very helpful and place very clean. Only downsides were the room was very small, not enough places to put things on especially in the bathroom ( but we were in the cheapest category of room) and felt the breakfast was not great. The second day we had to go for breakfast at the sister hotel and this was excellent.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Relais dei Fiori for 2 nights. Superb location, within 10 minutes walk of the Leaning Tower, and near a good choice of restaurants and bars. Simple breakfast buffet, small but pleasant rooms with air conditioning, TV, phones etc, and friendly staff. Overall good value and would recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in this Hotel on our way out to the Tuscan countryside to be able to see the town of Pisa. It is centrally located in the old town near to all the sites and restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent location, comfortable and reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is located within the restrticted traffic zone so be aware! You must get a permit to bring a car to that area from the Hotel. Somehow something went wrong for us and we picked up two heavy fines for entering the restricted zone to collect our baggage. The fine notices arrived 1 yr after we had been to the Hotel. To the hotels credit they undertook to take up the matter with the local police on our behalf and have resolved the matter - this was one year after we had stayed there - all credit to them :)
reviews.title: Great hotel in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked three rooms at the Relais dei Fiori as part of an Expedia vacation package, staying in Pisa for four nights as we used the city as a base for exploring other areas.
reviews.title: Like sleeping in an all-night party

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: clean room; satellite TV; free internet; good bedding; extremely helpful evening reception worker; adequate breakfast; safe neighborhood near the Tower, the university, and shopping.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not so good: some tiny rooms; no staff except evenings and breakfast; hot rooms with the only ventilation option a window which the cleaning staff insisted on closing during the day and which, during the night, let in so much noise that sleep was impossible; 25 minute walk to the train station; weak shower; few late-night dining options, especially on Sunday evening, other than a bistro up the street..
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two good nights at this hotel efter a very bad experience at "Relais under the tower".
reviews.title: Basic small 3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: We came at 10 in the morning and met the portier. He let us in and gave us the room, even though we actually couldn't check-in until 15.30. Very nice
reviews.title: Convenient location and fantastic service
